intro: Nonatelia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian star vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Nonatelia panamensis is often found in humid, lowland forests where it climbs trees and shrubs to reach sunlight.
